text.section:
If a local department is a child's guardian under this subtitle, a juvenile court:
retains jurisdiction until:
the child attains 18 years of age; or
the juvenile court finds the child to be eligible for emancipation; and
may continue jurisdiction until the child attains 21 years of age.

If a juvenile court designates an individual as a child's guardian, the juvenile court:
may retain jurisdiction until the child attains 18 years of age; or
on finding further review unnecessary to maintain the child's health and welfare, may terminate the case before the child attains 18 years of age.
An order for adoption of a child terminates the child's guardianship case.
On termination of a guardianship case, a juvenile court shall close the case.
